meanings.definition: A type of decorative script used in calligraphy.
meanings.sent1: The artist carefully practiced writing frakturs in calligraphy class.
meanings.sent2: The wedding invitation was beautifully written in elegant frakturs.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student doodled frakturs all over his notebook during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting was so intricate, it looked like frakturs dancing on the page.
meanings.sent5: The old book was filled with frakturs that seemed to come to life with each stroke of the pen.

meanings.definition: A type of German blackletter font.
meanings.sent1: The historical document was written in bold frakturs that were hard to read.
meanings.sent2: The menu at the German restaurant was printed in traditional frakturs.
meanings.sent3: The street artist painted graffiti in frakturs on the brick wall, giving it an old-world charm.
meanings.sent4: The frakturs on the signboard seemed to whisper tales of the past to those who passed by.
meanings.sent5: The book cover featured intricate frakturs that added a touch of elegance to the design.

meanings.sent1: The medieval library displayed rare frakturs that were a feast for the eyes.
meanings.sent2: The monk meticulously copied the text in frakturs onto the parchment.
meanings.sent3: The children's book was filled with colorful illustrations and frakturs that sparkled in the light.
meanings.sent4: The frakturs in the ancient tome seemed to glow with an otherworldly aura.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit showcased beautifully preserved frakturs from centuries ago.
